vulnerabilities.title: Missing Access Control
vulnerabilities.description: Critical function burn lacks proper access control modifier
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Add access control modifier (e.g., onlyOwner) to burn function

vulnerabilities.title: [MEV] Front-Running: Public Price-Affecting Change in transfer
vulnerabilities.description: Function transfer makes public state changes that affect prices. MEV bots can front-run to profit from predictable price impact.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
MEV Profit Potential: $1,000 - $50,000
User Loss Per TX: $500 - $10,000
Attack Complexity: medium
Time to Exploit: immediate
Historical Examples: DEX arbitrage front-runs: $200M+ (2024)
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use commit-reveal schemes or time-locks for sensitive operations. Consider using private mempools (e.g., Flashbots Protect) or submarine sends to hide transactions from front-runners.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Address Zero Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Parameter 'from' in function 'transferFrom' lacks address(0) check. OWASP 2025: Lack of Input Validation ($14.6M in losses). Funds sent to address(0) are permanently lost - no private key exists. This is a common attack vector in 2024-2025.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) public returns (bool) {
vulnerabilities.recommendation:
Add validation:
require(from != address(0), 'Zero address not allowed');

vulnerabilities.title: Loop Length Not Cached
vulnerabilities.description: Array length is read from storage in every loop iteration. Cache it in a local variable.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Cache array.length in a local variable before the loop. Use ++i instead of i++ for slightly lower gas.

vulnerabilities.title: Potential Integer Overflow/Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: Arithmetic operation without overflow protection: balanceOf[msg.sender] = balanceOf[msg.sender] - amount;...
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use SafeMath library or Solidity 0.8+ which has built-in overflow protection

vulnerabilities.title: Potential Integer Overflow/Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: Arithmetic operation without overflow protection: balanceOf[to] = balanceOf[to] + amount;...
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use SafeMath library or Solidity 0.8+ which has built-in overflow protection

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Array Bounds Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Array access 'balanceOf[to]' lacks bounds checking. Out-of-bounds access causes revert but wastes gas. OWASP 2025: Input Validation.
vulnerabilities.recommendation:
Add bounds check:
require(to < balanceOf.length, 'Index out of bounds');

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Array Bounds Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Array access 'balanceOf[from]' lacks bounds checking. Out-of-bounds access causes revert but wastes gas. OWASP 2025: Input Validation.
vulnerabilities.recommendation:
Add bounds check:
require(from < balanceOf.length, 'Index out of bounds');

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Array Bounds Validation
vulnerabilities.description: Array access 'allowance[from]' lacks bounds checking. Out-of-bounds access causes revert but wastes gas. OWASP 2025: Input Validation.
vulnerabilities.recommendation:
Add bounds check:
require(from < allowance.length, 'Index out of bounds');

vulnerabilities.title: Redundant Storage Access
vulnerabilities.description: Same storage location accessed multiple times in a single expression. Consider caching in memory.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Cache the storage value in a memory variable and reuse it.

vulnerabilities.title: Use Unchecked Block for Loop Counter
vulnerabilities.description: Loop counters in Solidity 0.8+ have overflow checks. Use unchecked{} block for loop increments to save gas.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Wrap loop increments in unchecked{} blocks. Loop counters will never realistically overflow.

vulnerabilities.title: [Symbolic Execution] Potential Integer Overflow in batchMint
vulnerabilities.description: Addition `i = 0; i < recipients.length; i + +)` at line 74 can overflow without `unchecked` block or overflow protection.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use Solidity 0.8+ which has built-in overflow protection, or wrap arithmetic in `unchecked {}` only when overflow is intended. Consider using SafeMath library for Solidity <0.8.

vulnerabilities.title: [Symbolic Execution] Potential Integer Overflow in batchMint
vulnerabilities.description: Addition `totalSupply = totalSupply + amounts[i]` at line 76 can overflow without `unchecked` block or overflow protection.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use Solidity 0.8+ which has built-in overflow protection, or wrap arithmetic in `unchecked {}` only when overflow is intended. Consider using SafeMath library for Solidity <0.8.

vulnerabilities.title: Use Prefix Increment (++i) Instead of Postfix (i++)
vulnerabilities.description: Prefix increment (++i) is slightly cheaper than postfix (i++) in loops.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use ++i instead of i++ in loops to save gas.

vulnerabilities.title: Function 'approve' Can Be External
vulnerabilities.description: Function is marked 'public' but appears to never be called internally. Use 'external' to save gas.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) public returns (bool) {
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Change 'public' to 'external' for functions not called internally. External functions can read arguments from calldata instead of copying to memory.

vulnerabilities.title: Cache msg.sender
vulnerabilities.description: msg.sender is accessed 2 times. Cache it in a local variable.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Cache msg.sender in a local variable at the start of the function.
